page.title: 02 Ecology
page.content: {Geology:}Most of the area is covered with shaly clay with thin limestones. Folly Hill is ferruginous limestone. Towards Staunton there is a strip of brown clay alluvium and a ridge of Rhaetic shales and limestone and some gypsum deposits. { {Climate:}The weather is variable with low rainfall, cold winters with frost and sometimes heavy snow, and warm summers. {Natural History:}The area is farmland, mostly mixed farms, arable and rough grazing for sheep and cattle. {Conservation:}Near Staunton, on the site of a disused limestone quarry is a nature reserve. There are plantations of trees and meadows of wild flowers. {Footpaths:}There are various footpaths through fields and a green lane which used to be an old coach road.
